topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Deploying a Cloud Definition Using the HCG Dashboard

body.p: The HCG Dashboard UI is a cloud management tool that allows users to define, deploy, manage, and monitor a HPE Helion OpenStack cloud. The tool helps you provide and validate the cloud definitions required to deploy your cloud and guide you through the deployment.
Click the Deploy Cloud link to open the cloud deployment table where you can deploy an existing cloud definition.

section.title: Deploy a cloud definition
section.p: To deploy an existing cloud definition:

ol.li: Make sure the correct cloud definition is selected. If not, click the Choose a different cloud button to open the List of Cloud Definitions table and select the correct definition.

Click Run to start deploying the cloud. The deployment consists of four phases: Provision, Generate, Netinit and Deploy. As the phases progress, you will see the name of your cloud and current status at the top of the page and the marker on the wizard will move to the process as it completes.
If you receive an error during the Deploy phase, rerun Deploy. The process runs in background. So while a process is running, if you close your session or browser, you can still return to the same page again to check status of your process.
